Michael Puckett, UI Engineer

I'm a software engineer currently based in Louisville, KY specializing in building accessible digital experiences.

Work Experience

  • LiveSchool — Nashville, TN — Frontend Engineer — 2018—Present

    LiveSchool is a classroom behavior-tracking platform with an audience of teachers, parents, and students.

  • Humana — Louisville, KY — Web Developer — 2016—2018

    I built and maintained a library of accessible web components that was shared across many enterprise products.

  • Apple — Cupertino, CA — UI Engineer — 2013—2016

    I built interfaces to support product launches, campaigns, and transactions on apple.com.

  • CNN — Atlanta, GA — Senior Web Developer — 2013—2013

    I worked on the responsive redesign and replatforming of cnn.com.

  • iostudio — Nashville, TN — Frontend Developer — 2012—2013

    I built marketing websites and web apps for national clients, including the National Guard.

  • Fruit of the Loom — Bowling Green, KY — Designer/Developer — 2011—2012

    I designed and developed a relaunch of jerzees.com.

  • 2-Com — Nashville, TN — Designer/Developer — 2010—2012

    I worked on a web app that generated print marketing materials for small businesses.

Skills

  • JavaScript Frontend Architecture

    I have an advanced understanding of the ES language, including recently added features such as async/await.

    I have evaluated JavaScript frameworks for use at enterprise scale, balancing various factors, including functionality, ecosystem, and performance.

    I have architected, deployed, and maintained web apps using Vue.js, React, Svelte, and Can.js.

    Although not my primary focus, I have some experience with Node.js, such as implementing frontend build systems.

  • Accessibility ADA/Section 508 Compliance

    To accommodate all users, including those using assistive technologies, such as screen readers or voice control, I implement semantic markup using ARIA and follow WCAG best practices.

    I have worked on websites subject to Section 508 of the US Rehabilitation Act, where the code I wrote needed to pass legal standards in regards to accessibility. This included manual testing, user testing, and ongoing accessibility audits.

  • Design Systems Styleguide Engineering

    My educational background in graphic design allows me to collaborate closely with designers and translate their intent into code.

    I have led successful projects to standardize, componentize, and document complex design systems for use by large cross-functional teams.

    I've found that developers can better communicate with designers by building a living library of reusable components that acts as a shared visual vocabulary.

  • Bowling Green, KY Area Convention and Visitors Bureau — Bowling Green, KY — Design/Development Intern — 2009—2009

    I launched a website overhaul that increased search engine rankings.

  • City of Bowling Green, KY — Bowling Green, KY — Design/Development Intern — 2008—2009

    I assisted in managing a 10,000-page website serving 50,000 constituents.

  • Rise Over Run Magazine — Bowling Green, KY — Founder/Editor-in-Chief — 2007—2009

    I started an online culture magazine that covered my local community. I built and maintained the website, produced and edited online content, art directed photo shoots, coordinated fundraising events, and managed a staff of student writers, photographers and videographers.

    The magazine won the 2007 Society of Professional Journalists Mark of Excellence Award for "Best All-Around Independent Online Student Publication."
